intro: Carpoxis, commonly known as the "false arum," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Araceae. It consists of several species, most of which are native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. The plants typically have arrow-shaped leaves and produce striking, spadix-like inflorescences surrounded by colorful bracts. Carpoxis species are often cultivated for their ornamental value due to their unique foliage and floral structures. They thrive in moist, shaded environments and are popular in water gardens and bog landscapes.
